snippet: General Motors and Ford reported a drop in July sales compared with a year ago, citing lower volume to rental fleets, while Chrysler posted a 13 percent increase.
abstract: Auto sales in the United States cool off in July as General Motors and Ford Motor Co report declines that they attribute partly to lower sales to rental car fleets; drop in sales at GM and Ford are offset by strong performances at Toyota and Honda; industry reports sales of 1.15 million vehicles during July, up 8.9 percent over July 2011; sales are still on track to top 14 million vehicles for 2012, but growth appears to be slowing.
lead_paragraph: General Motors and Ford reported a drop in July sales compared with a year ago, citing lower volume to rental fleets, while Chrysler posted a 13 percent increase.

headline.seo: Ford and G.M. Report Mixed Results for July Sales
headline.main: Fleet Sales Stall, and Automakers Report Results That Are Mixed
headline.print_headline: Fleet Sales Stall, And Automakers Report Results That Are Mixed
